newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia Jan-June foreign investment falls.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia Jan-June foreign investment falls.

text.p: Indonesian Investment Minister Sanyoto Sastrowardoyo said on Wednesday that foreign investment approved by the government fell to $15.47 billion during the first six months of the year from $20.96 billion in same period last year.
"Foreign investment approvals are $15.47 billion in the January-June 28 period, while we approved $20.96 billion in the same period last year," he told reporters
He has predicted approved foreign investment would be down in 1997 from $29.9 billion in 1996.
He has said the drop during the first six months was due to the country's general elections held at the end of May. There was considerable pre-poll violence.
